project.name: viewjs
project.description: JavaScript utility for client-side web application user interface development.

ViewJS.name: ViewJS
ViewJS.description:
#ViewJS
  - JavaScript utility/library that facilitates development of large scale client-side web applications with rich user interfaces
  - introduces a structural/architectural abstraction layer on top of common client-side web technology (HTML/CSS/JS)
  - inspired by and built around concepts found in native UI development

##Concept

Examination of a view from different perspectives & definition of terminology:

### View Component (architectural point of view)
  - a reusable component being instantiated at runtime
  - consists of a view controller and a bundle
  - behavior and styling may be extended/overridden/customized by inheritance/cascading

### View Controller (runtime/behavior point of view)
  - Constructor and prototype object providing common behavior across all instances of a view component

### View Bundle (resource/graphical representation point of view)
  - collection of resources providing means for a common graphical representation across all instances of a view component
  - e.g. HTML markup, CSS stylesheet, media resources (e.g. images/audio/video)

### View (general/runtime/instance point of view)
  - concrete instance of a view component
  - self-contained/self-managed piece of UI, most like a widget
  - scoping: managed DOM subtree that has scoped styling and behavior
  - composition: view instances can be in a parent/child relationship meaning that a view may have one or more other views nested inside of itself. This results in a tree structure, the "View Hierarchy"
  - lifecycle: a view has a lifecycle (construction/instantiation, loading, [showing, hiding, doing stuff], unloading, deallocation)
  - memory management
ViewJS.author: Andreas Tietz

View.name: View
View.description: Base implementation of a view controller providing scoped and configurable behavior across all instances of a view component.

classitems.description:
viewjs v0.2.1 (2014-02-15)

viewjs 0.2.1
Copyright (c) 2014, Andreas Tietz
Released under the MIT license

Helper function that facilitates prototypal inheritance from Views.

Note: Assign a name to the passed in constructor function in order for it to be correctly printed out in console logs.
classitems.name: extend

params.name: extension
params.description: Prototype attributes and methods being added to the view prototype to be inherited from.

classitems.description:
Function being called on the view itself when the "view did load" event occurs.

Inherited views may override and implement this function.
classitems.name: viewDidLoad

classitems.description:
Function being called on the view itself when the "view will unload" event occurs.

Inherited views may override and implement this function.
classitems.name: viewWillUnload

classitems.description: Helper function for defining properties.
classitems.name: defineProperty

params.name: accessors
params.description: Object defining set and get functions.

classitems.description: Unique name for the view to be distinguished from other views at the same hierarchy level.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: HTML & CSS module/filenames.
classitems.name: bundle

classitems.description: Determines whether the view is the first view in a view hierarchy and therefore has no parent view.
classitems.name: isRootView

classitems.description: Parent view up the view hierarchy that "owns" the view.
classitems.name: parentView

classitems.description: Direct child views down the view hierarchy "owned" by the view.
classitems.name: childViews

classitems.description: Subscription for "view did load" events.
classitems.name: onViewDidLoad

classitems.description: Subscription for "view will unload" events.
classitems.name: onViewWillUnload

classitems.description: Backup copy of the original container element to be restored when unloading.
classitems.name: _containerElement

classitems.description: Loaded view root DOM node (replacement of the original container element).
classitems.name: _viewElement

classitems.description: Determines whether the view's DOM is currently loaded.
classitems.name: isLoaded

classitems.description: Performs a jQuery selector scoped to the root element of a loaded view.

params.name: selector
params.description: jQuery selector being scoped to the root element.

return.description:
Root element of a loaded view if invoked without a parameter,
                         scoped jQuery selection result if invoked with a selector
                         or undefined if the view is not loaded.

classitems.description: Loads markup and styles from HTML and CSS files specified by the bundle property into the container element identified by the name property.
classitems.name: load

return.description: Promise for the "view did load" state.

classitems.description: Unloads the DOM by emptying the container.
classitems.name: unload

return.description: Promise for the "view will unload" state.

classitems.description: Provides a human readable string representation of a view.
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description:
Recursively traverses down the child view hierarchy of a view while invoking
a function for each view passing it the view and the recursion level.
classitems.name: traverse

params.name: fn
params.description: Function being invoked for each view and being passed the view object and the recursion level.

params.name: level
params.description: Indicates the current level of recursion.

classitems.description: Provides a human readable string representation of the current state of the child view hierarchy.
classitems.name: getViewHierarchyHumanReadable

return.description: String representation of the child view hierarchy.
